__TOC__

This is the place to propose changes to the Supported seed.  Read the criteria on the SeedManagement page before making a proposal.

 a. openmcu, openam, gnugk: complete VoIP support with multipoint conference and answering machine to complement gnomemeeting
 a. genius and gnome-genius: good, modern replacement for bc/dc, when the normal calculator isn't enough.
 a. seahorse # LeeColleton: Make it easy for people to manage their GPG keys
 a. gaim-encryption # LeeColleton: Gaim-Encryption uses NSS to provide transparent RSA encryption as a Gaim plugin
 a. <nowiki>[[http://beepmp.sf.net|beep-media-player]]</nowiki> # StaffanBjorklund: GTK+2 port of xmms, fits in more consistenly with gnome 2.x.
 a. br2684ctl # NunoFerreira: needed to support PPPoE with USB DSL modems
 a. bzflag # TreyEarl: nice network based tank shooter... very fun and addicting  :)
 a. isakmpd # or some other isakmp implementation, such as racoon (MattZimmerman)
 a. pcc-acpi hotkey driver for brightness, volume and other controls for Panasonic laptops (<nowiki>[[http://www.netlab.is.tsukuba.ac.jp/~yokota/izumi/panasonic_acpi/|driver page]]</nowiki>)
 a. fdclock # DanielStone: it's a nice clock
 a. xcompmgr # DanielStone: certainly not in Desktop, but enough people want to use it for it to be worth it to support imo
 a. transset # DanielStone: see above
 a. python-beautifulsoup # AndrewBennetts.  No debian package, but it's a single <code>.py</code> file so that's easy to fix.  http://www.crummy.com/software/BeautifulSoup/ -- extremely useful for screen-scraping scripts.
 a. pythoncard # AndrewBennetts: A "GUI building made easy" application for Python and wx.  Or maybe we should support glade-2 or gazpacho instead?
 a. irda-utils # ThorstenTasch: needed for irda
 a. <nowiki>[[http://tvtime.sourceforge.net/|tvtime]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://zapping.sourceforge.net|zapping]]</nowiki> or similar # trinux: for watching tv. tvtime is better than zapping and its develop team looks like more dynamic
 a. vnc4server # SebWills: useful for servers
 a. php4-gd2, php4-imagick, php4-mysql, php4-pear, php4-sqlite, php4-xslt # SebWills: many of these are needed by "typical" php4 applications 
 a. phpmyadmin # SebWills: used on many servers hosting mysql databases
 a. wpa-supplicant # Alex: allows *basic* security (not complete by any means) of wireless networks

=== Emacs Support ===

 a. mailcrypt # JamesTroup: GPG support for emacs

=== Server related stuff ===

 a. scponly # JamesTroup: limit accounts to scp only
 a. archzoom # JamesTroup: web interface a la viewcvs for arch - will need a security review

=== Dial-up related ===

 a. wwwoffle # LexHider: allows us dialup users to view pages we've looked at while offline. Note that firefox offline mode is completely inadequate for this task.
 a. privoxy # LexHider: will block a large number of internet advertising banners.
 a. trickle # LexHider: bandwidth shaper to stop some apps from hogging your bandwidth. tiny.
